meanings.definition: The act of determining the route or course to be taken.
meanings.sent1: The routeing of the hiking trail was carefully planned to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: She studied the map for hours before finally routeing the best path to the waterfall.
meanings.sent3: The routeing of the marathon runners led them through unexpected challenges.
meanings.sent4: In life, we are constantly routeing our way through various decisions and obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The routeing of the treasure map made the adventure even more exciting.

meanings.definition: The process of planning and organizing a route for travel.
meanings.sent1: Routeing a road trip involves choosing the best stops along the way.
meanings.sent2: The routeing of the bus schedule was done efficiently to minimize delays.
meanings.sent3: The routeing of the family vacation turned into a fun game of choosing destinations.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a busy airport, constantly routeing flights to different destinations.
meanings.sent5: The routeing of the train tracks through the mountains was a remarkable engineering feat.

meanings.definition: The act of directing or guiding someone along a particular route.
meanings.sent1: His routeing of the lost hikers saved them from wandering deeper into the forest.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide's routeing of the group ensured they didn't miss any important landmarks.
meanings.sent3: The routeing of the children through the maze was both challenging and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a compass, always routeing her friends towards fun adventures.
meanings.sent5: The routeing of the delivery trucks was crucial to ensure timely distribution of goods.
